timeline.message: Inline the remaining uses of DocValuesIndexFieldData.Builder

timeline.bodyText: Is numericType required? Maybe it can be final a ctor arg?
timeline.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: I wonder if all of these sorts of args can be ctor args.
replies.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I think they can.  I'll take a pass at it.
replies.author: not-napoleon

timeline.bodyText: I see what you mean about copying method around and maybe making an abstract base class at some point. But the copying is fine by me as an intermediate step to untwisting all of this.
timeline.author: nik9000

timeline.bodyText: What would you think about removing 'DV' from all of these class names? Now that they don't extend DocValuesIndexFieldData, I think it's a bit confusing/ unclear what 'DV' refers to.
timeline.author: jtibshirani

replies.bodyText: Yeah, that seems reasonable, will do.
replies.author: not-napoleon

timeline.bodyText: Could the builder return a IndexNumericFieldData?
timeline.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: Like, not all the builders can, but I'm fairly sure the SortedNumericIndexFieldData builder will only ever build numeric field data.
replies.author: nik9000
